fields.description:
This mutation creates an `Article`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `Article` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "ARTICLE-001",
    "entityType": "ARTICLE",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}

The current status of the `Article`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

The current status of the `Article`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
Creates a `Comment` against a known entity

This mutation creates a `FulfilmentPlan`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `FulfilmentPlan` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "FULFILMENTPLAN-001",
    "entityType": "FULFILMENTPLAN",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}
External reference. Recommended to be unique.

The current status of the `FulfilmentOption`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
A unique identifier for the clients to group related Fulfilment Plans.
A list of attributes associated with this object. This can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
External reference. Recommended to be unique.

The current status of the `FulfilmentPlan`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
ETA of the `FulfilmentPlan`. Although this can be set explicitly, we recommend that this be determined and set in the workflow.
A list of attributes associated with this object. This can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Exceptions can be used to augment the existing object with any useful information in case of exceptions.
The english like description of the exception
Attributes may contain useful information about the exception
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.

This mutation creates a `Fulfilment`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `Fulfilment` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "FULFILMENT-001",
    "entityType": "FULFILMENT",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}

The current status of the `Fulfilment`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The unique reference identifier for the Inventory Quantity

The current status of the `InventoryQuantity`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The actual amount of this specific Quantity record
The location (i.e. store) id provided by the retailer
The location status. Possible values are 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE'.

This mutation creates a `FinancialTransaction`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `FinancialTransaction` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "FINANCIALTRANSACTION-001",
    "entityType": "FINANCIALTRANSACTION",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}
The unique transaction reference provided by the Retailer to the payment gateway

This mutation creates a `Wave`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `Wave` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "WAVE-001",
    "entityType": "WAVE",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}
External reference of the object. Must be unique.
The unique article reference provided by the retailer
Type of the `Article`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.

The current status of the `Article`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
A list of edges that links to ArticleItem type node
The item at the end of the ArticleItem edge
A list of edges that links to Fulfilment type node
The item at the end of the Fulfilment edge
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.

The current status of the `Fulfilment`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Type of delivery. Supported values are _STANDARD_, _OVERNIGHT_ and _EXPRESS_.

Type of the `Fulfilment`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Type of fulfilment. Supported types are
- *CC_PFS* for Click & Collect - Pick from Store - *CC_PFDC* for Click & Collect - Pick from DC - *HD_PFS* for Home Delivery - Pick from Store - *HD_PFDC* for Home Delivery - Pick from DC
The estimated time of completing the fulfilment.
External reference of the object. Must be unique.

Currently supports values _CC_, _SFS_, _HD_ for _Click and Collect_, _Ship from Store_ and _Home Delivery_ type orders respectively

operations.source:
query GetLocationById($id: ID!) {
  locationById(id: $id) {
    __typename
    id
    ref
    type
    status
    attributes {
      __typename
      name
      type
      value
    }
    name
    supportPhoneNumber
    defaultCarrier
    defaultCarrierName
    primaryAddress {
      __typename
      id
      type
      companyName
      name
      street
      city
      state
      postcode
      region
      country
      latitude
      longitude
      longitude
      ref
      timeZone
    }
    retailer {
      __typename
      id
      status
      ref
      summary
    }
  }
}

fields.description: The location (i.e. store) id provided by the retailer
The location status. Possible values are 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE'.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Store location of the the location
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER

operations.sourceWithFragments:
query GetLocationById($id: ID!) {
  locationById(id: $id) {
    __typename
    id
    ref
    type
    status
    attributes {
      __typename
      name
      type
      value
    }
    name
    supportPhoneNumber
    defaultCarrier
    defaultCarrierName
    primaryAddress {
      __typename
      id
      type
      companyName
      name
      street
      city
      state
      postcode
      region
      country
      latitude
      longitude
      longitude
      ref
      timeZone
    }
    retailer {
      __typename
      id
      status
      ref
      summary
    }
  }
}

operations.source:
query GetLocationByRef($ref: String!, $includePrimaryAddress: Boolean!, $includeAttributes: Boolean!, $includeOpeningSchedule: Boolean!, $includeRetailer: Boolean!, $includeNetworks: Boolean!, $includeStorageAreas: Boolean!) {
  location(ref: $ref) {
    __typename
    ref
    id
    type
    status
    name
    supportPhoneNumber
    defaultCarrier
    defaultCarrierName
    primaryAddress @include(if: $includePrimaryAddress) {
      __typename
      id
      ref
      type
      companyName
      name
      street
      city
      state
      postcode
      region
      country
      latitude
      longitude
      timeZone
    }
    attributes @include(if: $includeAttributes) {
      __typename
      type
      name
      value
    }
    openingSchedule @include(if: $includeOpeningSchedule) {
      __typename
      id
      createdOn
      updatedOn
      allHours
      monEnd
      monStart
      tueEnd
      tueStart
      wedEnd
      wedStart
      thuEnd
      thuStart
      friEnd
      friStart
      satEnd
      satStart
      sunEnd
      sunStart
    }
    retailer @include(if: $includeRetailer) {
      __typename
      id
      ref
    }
    networks @include(if: $includeNetworks) {
      __typename
      networkEdge: edges {
        __typename
        networkNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          status
        }
      }
    }
    storageAreas @include(if: $includeStorageAreas) {
      __typename
      storageEdge: edges {
        __typename
        storageNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          status
          type
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

fields.description: The location (i.e. store) id provided by the retailer
The location status. Possible values are 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE'.
Store location of the the location
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Networks the location is assigned to
A list of edges that links to Network type node

operations.sourceWithFragments:
query GetLocationByRef($ref: String!, $includePrimaryAddress: Boolean!, $includeAttributes: Boolean!, $includeOpeningSchedule: Boolean!, $includeRetailer: Boolean!, $includeNetworks: Boolean!, $includeStorageAreas: Boolean!) {
  location(ref: $ref) {
    __typename
    ref
    id
    type
    status
    name
    supportPhoneNumber
    defaultCarrier
    defaultCarrierName
    primaryAddress @include(if: $includePrimaryAddress) {
      __typename
      id
      ref
      type
      companyName
      name
      street
      city
      state
      postcode
      region
      country
      latitude
      longitude
      timeZone
    }
    attributes @include(if: $includeAttributes) {
      __typename
      type
      name
      value
    }
    openingSchedule @include(if: $includeOpeningSchedule) {
      __typename
      id
      createdOn
      updatedOn
      allHours
      monEnd
      monStart
      tueEnd
      tueStart
      wedEnd
      wedStart
      thuEnd
      thuStart
      friEnd
      friStart
      satEnd
      satStart
      sunEnd
      sunStart
    }
    retailer @include(if: $includeRetailer) {
      __typename
      id
      ref
    }
    networks @include(if: $includeNetworks) {
      __typename
      networkEdge: edges {
        __typename
        networkNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          status
        }
      }
    }
    storageAreas @include(if: $includeStorageAreas) {
      __typename
      storageEdge: edges {
        __typename
        storageNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          status
          type
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

fields.description: The location (i.e. store) id provided by the retailer
The location status. Possible values are 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE'.
Store location of the the location

operations.source:
query GetUserByRef($username: String!) {
  user(username: $username) {
    __typename
    id
    ref
    status
    type
    title
    firstName
    lastName
    username
    primaryEmail
    primaryPhone
  }
}

typesUsed.name: UpdateInventoryQuantityInput
typesUsed.description:
Input parameter for the `updateInventoryQuantity` mutation. An inventory quantity `ref` is unique within the bounds of the specified `catalogue`, which together makes up the unique identifier for the `InventoryQuantity` record.

During an update mutation, the following fields behave in an "UPSERT" or UPDATE / INSERT manner: * `attributes` - `name` is the unique key for the Attribute `type` and `value`. If an associated Attribute with a matching `name` already exists, then the `type` and `value` fields will be updated, else it will be inserted. **Backward Compatibility Note**

With the introduction of Global Inventory, we have introduced new data structures to support this functionality. Existing orchestration enabled clients will have access to their existing product based data via the `COMPATIBILITY:` catalogue.

For more information, please refer to the Backward Compatibility Guide on Lingo

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
The unique reference identifier for the Inventory Quantity.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: catalogue
fields.description: The Inventory Catalogue in which this Position is managed

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `InventoryQuantity`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `InventoryQuantity`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes associated with this Inventory Quantity. This can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The actual amount of this specific Quantity record

fields.name: condition
fields.description: The condition of the Inventory Quantity value. The platform does not enforce any values here. Examples could include `NEW`, `USED`, or `DAMAGED`

fields.name: expectedOn
fields.description: The date and time the quantity is expected to arrive

fields.name: storageAreaRef
fields.description:
A reference to the Storage Area where this inventory is kept.
Max character limit: 100.

typesUsed.name: InventoryCatalogueKey
typesUsed.description: The `InventoryCatalogueKey` input is the parameter for identifying a specific Inventory Catalogue.

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
Inventory Catalogue reference identifier.
Max character limit: 100.

typesUsed.name: CreateOpeningScheduleInput
typesUsed.description: OpeningSchedule

typesUsed.name: CreateUserInput
typesUsed.description: Creates a new `User`

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: username
fields.description:
Unique name for the user used for identification and logging purposes.
Max character limit: 250.

fields.name: password
fields.description:
Password. # **Note**

Please note that password once created can not be retrieved via the API at the moment. We are working on a security model that will enable password viewing to authenticated customers but until then, we request you to remember the password you created the `User` with.
Max character limit: 128.

fields.name: title
fields.description:
The user's title. For example _Mr._, _Miss_, _Dr._, _Ms._ etc
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description:
User's first name.
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description:
User's last name.
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: primaryEmail
fields.description:
User's primary email.
Max character limit: 250.

fields.name: primaryPhone
fields.description:
User's primary phone number.
Max character limit: 20.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the user. This type is currently supports one of the following three values: _ADMIN_, _RETAILER_, _LOCATION_

fields.name: apiKey
fields.description:
API Key. To be used with the Fluent Widget.
Max character limit: 128.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes associated with this object. This can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.

fields.name: language
fields.description: User language (leave null to allow users to self-select their language preference)

fields.name: promotionOptIn
fields.description: Determines if the user has opted to receive promotions

fields.name: roles
fields.description: A list of roles along with their contexts which are to be assigned to the user.

typesUsed.name: UserRoleInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to assign a `Role` with it's context to the `User` object

fields.name: role
fields.description: Input to identify the role to be assigned

fields.name: contexts
fields.description: Context for the role being assigned

typesUsed.name: RoleKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify a `Role` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the role which is unique and acts as a key to identify the role itself

typesUsed.name: RoleContextInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to supply context during assignment of a role

fields.name: contextType
fields.description: Represents the type of context. For more information on contexts and how they relate to user and roles, please visit User's section on Lingo.

fields.name: contextId
fields.description: Represents the identity of the context object.

typesUsed.name: UpdateOrderInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to update an `Order`

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `Order`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

typesUsed.name: UpdateOrderItemWithOrderInput
typesUsed.description:
Input type to update an `OrderItem` with an `Order`. Intended to be used as an inline input in the _updateOrder_ mutation.

**NOTE**
This mutation has potential implications on existing `Order`s and their workflows. We recommend this mutation to be not used directly. It should either be called from a user action or from within a workflow.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: External reference for the object. Recommended to be unique.

fields.name: productRef
fields.description: External reference for the associated product.

fields.name: productCatalogueRef
fields.description:
External reference for the product catalogue containing the associated product (specified using the `productRef`in this object).
 When `productCatalogueRef` is not passed, the compatibility catalogue for this product is used.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the OrderItem. Currently supported values are limited to _CREATED_, _NEW_, _COMPLETE_.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency. Should ideally be a 3 letter ISO currency code. For instance _AUD_.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: List of `OrderItem` `attribute`s. There's expected a JSON object

typesUsed.name: CreateFinancialTransactionInput
typesUsed.description: Financial Transaction

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `FinancialTransaction`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Max character limit: 25.

typesUsed.name: CreateWaveInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to create a `Wave`

fields.name: ref
fields.description: External reference of the object. Must be unique.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the `Wave`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes associated with this wave. Attributes can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.

fields.name: allocatedTo
fields.description: `User` who this wave is assigned to

typesUsed.name: UpdateWaveInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to update a `Wave`

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the `Wave` to be updated

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the `Wave`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `Wave`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes associated with this wave. `Attribute`s can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, UI etc.

fields.name: fulfilments
fields.description: Fulfilments associated with this wave. This field can be used to add new fulfilments to the wave. Existing fulfilments can't be deleted.

fields.name: allocatedTo
fields.description: `User` who this wave is assigned to

typesUsed.name: VirtualCatalogueKey
typesUsed.description: The `VirtualCatalogueKey` input is the parameter for identifying a specific Virtual Catalogue

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
Virtual Catalogue reference identifier.
Max character limit: 100.

typesUsed.name: ProductQuantityInput
typesUsed.description: Type to encapsulate a product and its requested quantity

typesUsed.name: GeoCoordinateInput
typesUsed.description: Information required to identify a geographical location. For instance Sydney has latitude, longitude values of _-33.868820_ and _151.209296_ respectively.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Geographical coordinate that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earth's surface

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Geographical coordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth's surface
